tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: he is a very good doctor. My daughter had a cough from 45 days ago, we went some two hospitals but no body gave proper treatment. finally i searched in online for best pediatrician in bengaluru. I found prashath gowda , we explained all issues about my daughter. he identified dust allergy. he gave medication for 10 days. now my daughter has no cough it was totally reduced. Treatment is good. but he should to have some patiency while discussing problems. overall he is good doctor recommeneded to visit.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Doctor Prashanth is Awesome .....he is very friendly as I went with my mom she don't know English. .then for making her confortable he started taking in Hindi and explain each and every thing doubt what we had as a normal behaviour of baby without asking by us....thanks doctor

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
Have visited to doctor twice, both time had to wait for 1 hour from appointment time.
1st time for showing for jaundice and regular follow up after birth, he just saw the report checked by nurses from external devices. Didn’t even examined the baby, didn’t even touch him and just wrote some medicines. And there was no communication with us (parents) as well. Was very surprised by this.

Next we visited another doctor ****** **** ** **** ********* **** ****** *** *********** ** ****** *** ************ my wife didn’t remembered doctor’s name at that moment and hospital mentioned Prashant Gowda, so we booked appointment with him. 

This time also, he came very late, didn’t had any communication with us or examined the baby, just put the vaccination without consoling/diverting the kid. Felt very robotic and no empathy. 

Both time he just pointed to his hospital and shared number of his hospital. And I think this is the only thing he spoke to us. 

This was my last time I visited to him. But as it happened twice I felt its better to share the experience and feedback.

Both

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: We visited doctor few times for the follow up for our baby and all 3 times we had to wait at least for 30 min with the baby on hands. My question is - if the doctor can’t ever come on time, what is the reason to give appointment slot for the time he can’t be in the clinic? ******* *** ****** ***** **** **** *** ***** ***** ** ******** ******** *** ** ***** **** ****** **** **** ****** *** ** ******* *** *** **** ********* ** **** ********** *****  He prescribed my baby iron drops ***** ** *** ******** *** *** ** *** *** ****** ****** ******* ***** * **** **** ** ****** *** ** ***** ********** *** ***** ** ****** ** ** **** ** *** ********* ** *** ******** **** **** ** *** *** ** **** ****** **** ** ** ** ****** ******** *** ************** His answers over WhatsApp which he gave is not precise, looks like he is not interested in patients. It breaks trust to the docto* ***** ***** **** ** ** *********** *** **** ***** ** ******** ******* ***** **** ******* ** **** ***** Very disappointed ** * ******* ********** ** ******* *** ********** *** **************

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
When we went for the first consultation after the delivery of the baby in Motherhood hospital, the first thing he did was to give us a sheet mentioning about his clinic instead to listening to us about the reason for our visit. After that he got some calls on his mobile which he took almost 10 mins to finish. After all this he just checked the baby and said all is fine.
His behaviour was very unprofessional and i would recommend the doctor to first listen to the patient, and check the baby. He can give his clinic information in the end once the consultation is finished. Also taking calls in the middle of the consultation and that too for more than 10 mins is not at all good and shows a high level of unprofessionalism. Urgent calls can be taken but the calls that were taken during the consultation could have been easily taken afterwards.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I visited this Dr because hospital suggested in discharge summary. During our first visit even after taking appointment I have waited more than 40min and he didn't even looked at our kid. Our kid is having mild newborn jaundice and we are waiting for nearly 1 hr and he didnt have a look at my kid also l. Straight away given some blood test and he didn't explained what to do after the test results he just left for the day. **** **** ** ** ** **** ****** **** * **** ** *** ******* *** no consern about the patient.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review:
my son 4.5 years was given same vaccination consecutively. Vaccination given last month was repeated again. so we are very much concerned and serious about child's repeated vaccination.   1) will it cause overdose 2) and adverse affect , reaction allergy 


********** ****** **** ****** ****** ** *********** ** ** ***** ** ****** ****** ****** ********** ***** *********** *** **** ****** ****** *** ************   it should entered in computer system, should not be just written in file.

we strongly request for refund and assurance of well being of my child

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Had booked appointment with the doctor because baby was having issues with feeding and was having cold. Doctor had gone on rounds so we had to wait for more than 1 hour. It will be good if no appointments are booked during the time doctor goes for rounds. **** ** ******* *** **** ****** *** **** *** *** **** ******** ********. After we explained the issue, the doctor just used stethoscope to check for cold while the baby was still in my lap. He then straight away started typing out the medicine on his system and handed us a print out. Was very surprised to see that doctor did not even ask if we are administering any other medicine to the baby or how many days the condition is existing. For a consultation fees of 800 Rs. and more than 1 hour wait time, we expected better treatment instead of mere 5 minutes. Also, one of the medicines he prescribed is not available inside the motherhood pharmacy and is it not available anywhere else even in online meds.  *** **** ******** ***** ** ** **** **** *** **** ***** * **** ***** ** **** ** **** * ****** **** He was unavailable to contact to get an alternate medicine. Very disappointed. Doctor must prescribe medicines which are easily available else it's difficult for babies.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,
review: Today I visited this dr for my 4 yr old kid's vaccination, and Iam 36 weeks pregnant..there was a huge crowd waiting for drs  in paediatric session and from help desk, they are telling everyone that there is a waiting period of 1.5 hrs  as all the drs are busy....I have been waiting inside his cabin for more than 5 min...he was over phone and doing self praising..in between nurse came with 2 slips and she wrote down the medicine name to buy from pharmacy for vaccination..he didn't even bother to check the details  of the vaccination or anything, simply he signed at the end ...we are paying 600/- for consultation...later nurse told me to sit and he was still over phone...after 10 min of waiting dr cut the call and talked to me ....he understood iam not happy with his behaviour..so he took over care of my kid nd myself asking about my health, my due etc etc...didn't expect such an unprofessional behaviour from a dr...I won't recommend him...he was talking with a smiley face and very friendly at the end...but that won't make him a good dr....may be he qualified and experienced...but should change the attitude..
reply_text: Thanks for the feedback. I generally do not respond to any feedback as experience/feedback can be be very subjective . But my concern towards you or your baby was genuine , for your 600 rupees, i do not want to do any drama of pseudo caring, without understanding the real care and doctors social standing pls do not post this type of feedback as money is not a concern to me or to my family, we are sufficiently well placed with proper family values not to do drama for your 600 rupees,,Respect doctors, think twice before you write on any doctors after meeting for 5 minutes.If you have a problem meet again or meet hospital administration solve it and then if its still feel negative , write a feedback  it makes so much of sense, all the best for your delivery.

tags: None
review: A big thanks to Dr. Prashanth for his support during my son's stay at NICU. Since then we have been consulting him for any health related issues of my son as well as for vaccination. *** *********** ****** **** ********* **** ***** I would highly recommend him for any paediatric problems...

review: He has a unique way of interacting with the children. He lets them relax and get comfortable with him, that takes away the child's anxiety associated with a doctor visit. He then does the diagnosis as he is playing and interacting with the child* ***** **** ************* *** **** communicates the issues and treatment options quite well.

tags: None
review: The very first day of fever, he asked us to go for the blood check up for our 8 months old baby. He scared us with so many things and even before the reports came he was suggesting for the antibiotic treatment with IV.  And the experience with motherhood hospital was extremely bad since no one respects your time there....overall a big NO

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Thanks to Dr. Prashanth Gowda he is very kind and patience, he listened all of our requests and questions carefully and answered us, and he explained important information about vaccinations, new born feeding and care. I would strongly recommend Dr. Prashanth Gowda (Neonatologist & Paediatrician) at Motherhood Hospital.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
My son had cold and cough . He is 1.5 years old and he had ear pain .  Since we told that he had cold and cough , without checking my son he started writing medicines .  We insisted the doctor to check whether he had any infection . The doctor said there is no ear infection . 

We gave the medicines prescribed by the doctor. After hours also my son had the same pain and then we tested another doctor *** ***** **** ** *** *** *** ********* * 

I would not recommend this doctor to anyone .

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
context: Pediatric Vaccinations,Paediatric Critical Care,Newborn Jaundice,Neonates,Consultation provided for newborns ,
review: Dr Prasanth is my kids' doctor since the day they were born.It is  due to his expertise in neonatology that my kids are happy healthy preschoolers today despite of being born prematurely  and underweight. He is very good with children and understands the parents stress. all vaccination sessions with have been smooth and painless. highly recommended.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Prashanth is very ************** genuine and highly qualified. He is someone who can be easily relied on in times of bad health. We sincerely thank you for the treatment given to our kid. Dr Prashanth has very caring attitude towards children. What we thought is you are doing a wonderful job

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Visited doctor as my child was having stomach pain and fever. To my surprise, he didn't even checked my son or asked about any history, ****** **** ******* *** **** ***** ** **** He ****** prescribed the medicine ******* **** ******** ** ***. Afer prescribing the medicine, he did checking for a sec.

*** *** ****** ********* ******** ******* **** ********

Also he doesn't give enough time to patients. If one look at his appointments slots at Motherhood, they are of 4 minutes interval, which is too short to attend a patient who is paying ₹750 for his time.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review:
I don’t mind with the waiting time for doctor after the vaccination we asked him to check baby skin he just had a peek at it and just referred to his/promote other hospital for skin care .
I amount of time he spent to write down the number for appointment is more than the amount of time he spent to check the baby.
When we went to the skin specialist her expression was like “really for this”.
In not about the money think about the pain we go through and the doubts we will have about baby conditions just so to promote other hospital

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,
review:
Well - my little one developed rashes on her body with high fever and my experience as below

He kept us waiting for 5 to 6 mins ******* ***** * **** ****** **** *** *** **** while my kid was in pain. It is no coincidence that this happened as it is my second experience ***** ** **** ***** * ********* ** ******** ****** **** ****** **** **** ** ******
Coming to the treatment he did not even care to examine her and directly gone to give a lengthy prescription with a steroid. ** *** ** ** ****** **** ***** *** **** **** ********* **** ***** * ********* *** ** ***** *** *********** *** had to visit another doctor on the same day. I won’t go back *** **** * ** **** **** ******
reply_text: It’s very sad and worrying that as parent you don’t know what you want, over hearing doctors conversation with others and commenting on that, rather than focusing on your kids problem. you should choose doctors only if you are confident on the doctor, no one is forcing you to choose any doctor, no one is compelling to see any doctor in particular, you can always ask doctors if you don’t understand prescription and what doctor think about the problem, rather than googling and deciding what is the right treatment, better Donot come to doctor, if you know what is right treatment. If Donot like treatment and service provided by doctor, it’s your personal wish, but respect doctors and services provided to your kid. Please grow up and exhibit maturity and humanity to your fellow human being. Don’t talk more than your capacity.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review: We visited for our baby's fever and they didn't even bother to take a note of his temperature.  Doctor was looking at his laptop most of the time and typed prescription without even giving a detailed check. The waiting time was too much. Doctor came in late and took more than half an hour for a counselling session for a new parent couple, while many emergency cases were waiting outside and once the session was over we had to give our slot to one of the emergency case and by the time our turn came, our baby got sleepy and fussy and the whole experience was really bad.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Doctor Prashanth was very patient with my child and really put him at ease, despite his pain. 

He attended to various questions asked by me in detail.

review: Doctor didn't gave time to us. ****** ** ***** *** ****** ******* he didn't listen the words  and didnt ask for sit on the chair. he was is only full hurry-burry to leave the hospital. talking in phone *** *** ******** *** *******  *** ******** ******* ** ********  ********

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: The doctor doesnot have any time for you, He just keeps looking in his laptop while you describe your problem and gives you medicine within 2 minutes of consultation without deep diving into history of the patient. He gave us medicines for Asthma and Diarrhea when we visited him only for cough and cold with no respiratory complaint.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr Prashant is an excellent doctor.  He counselled me about my daughter's health  and about parenting.  It's so comforting to visit a doctor who thinks of your child as a blessing from God rather than just another patient.  **** ** ** **** ************* ** he knows as parents we are worried and stressed and so he asks us to focus on what's important for you and your child rather than just worry.  Thank you Doctor.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: Kid was having stomach infections. However doctor mentioned loose motion and vomiting. ********* *** ** **** ******* ******* * ***** After meeting second time for infection with Antibiotics he never asked to stop medication ***** *** *** ********* ** **** *****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Doctor is very nice, listened all issues and suggested solutions. examined baby properly. felt like we have met multiple times,though its just my third visit.suggested few medicines from different vendors,so that I can use as per my budget. only thing I suggest for others is to visit him weekdays,as over weekend number of kids are more. (As he is good,every one wants to visit him)

tags: Value for money,
review: Doctor has written vaccination of the foreign company which costs Rs. 4900 The same vaccination from other company like galaxo, cipla costs was available at Rs1000-1500. I have also asked them if the same vaccination is available from other company, the answer was no. Doctors should be open to tell why he is opting for costly vaccination from foreign company. Issue had been raised to concerned hospital but no action.
reply_text: Thanks for the feedback. I appreciate your concern. Please go through WHO  prequalified vaccine list. If you are talking about gsk 10 valent Pcv vaccine. I am sorry it’s not recommended by WHO(world health Organization). WHO recommends 13 valent vaccine. Before writing feedback please get complete information and than write. We don’t write vaccine based our wish. There is policy and recommendations done by WHO/IAP. we need to follow that. Not the brands. Price of the vaccine is decided by government not the doctor. Vaccine at motherhood hospital is always done with parents consent never forced or implied on parents.

tags: Wait time,Doctor friendliness,
review: I’m happy about the friendliness behaviour from doctor Prasanth. But really not sure why he has prescribed medicine Asthalin to my daughter *** ***** **** * ***** ****  ** *** ** ************* ******** ** * ***** *********** ******** *** **** ** ** **** ******* ***** *** ****** ** ****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Very good doctor.we have been consulting him  since my daughter's birth. Very courteous and gives proper attention and understands the health issues of the kid also prescribes right medicine as per requirements.it's been wonderful to have him as our peadiatrician.Thank you so much Dr Prashanth.
